reviewText: I just keep on buying his dvd,d,I never tire of them. I now have about 35 and love each one. He travels to other countries and the places you see are awesome. The place is always packed with thousands of people. They have a great following and I can see why. This will always be one of my favorite ,and it brings tears to my eyes,its done so well. Thanks to Bill you can really enjoy some great videos.

reviewText: This is a patriotic video with Homecoming style singing, a stage full of voices, filmed at Carnegie Hall in New York City. The Gaither Vocal Band on this video consists of Bill, David, Guy, and Russ. On stage are other former GVB singers Marshall Hall, Mark Lowry, and others. Anthony Burger on piano. A full orchestra. Mark does a very funny skit. Two other comedians do skits also. Other singers are The Martins, The Hoppers, The Isaacs, Sue Dodge, George Younce, Jake Hess, Sandy Patti, and many others. It is a very touching video which honors many of New York's finest firemen and policemen. At the end when the Vocal Band sings "Let Freedom Ring" it is just absolutely outstanding. A wonderful tribute to our beautiful country, this video makes any American proud to be an American. I loved it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Patriotic and reverently presented, it is a good DVD, done at about the same time as 'God Bless America.' Victory and hope seem to be the theme. 'God Bless America' is more diversified, I think, and has some extraordinary talent, (that one would not see often). The Vocal Band's first song on 'Let Freedom Ring' is not my favorite, but this must not discourage you, because -I can assure you- their last song which is actually the song,'Let Freedom Ring,' beats even the performance they did for the US President. I was inspired. The Martin's were great, and he Hoppers lively and entertaining, with other good songs from other good folks as well.Not that I am a worthy critic, but in just about any production, there is something that I would probably have changed or left out. Nonetheless, overall, these were especially good purchases for me, and I am ever so careful about spending money. So, there you go.  Mickey

reviewText: "Let Freedom Ring" is one of my favorites of the Gaither Homecoming Series.  A few of my favorites include: Ivan Parker singing "God Bless the USA"and"You'll Never Walk Alone" as sung by Armond Morales. Larnelle Harris and Sandi Patty received a standing ovation when they joined their voices in the song "More Than Wonderful."Another special feature was the recitation of "The Survivor" featuring Mort Crim. I also seeing and hearing Terry Blackwood featured in "This Land is Your Land" and "A Few Good Men." He was also featured with David Phelps in "The Battle Hymn of Republic." Stirring. The Gaither Vocal Band" was featured in "I Pledge My Allegiance" and "Let Freedom Ring." Outstanding.Comedy Acts included: "You Needed Me," a special song arranged for Lowry parodying his leaving the Gaither Vocal Band. Taylor Mason and Ken David added another light touch to the evening with their clowning.A great evening of inspiration, patriotism, gospel music, and light hearted humor.
summary: A Tribute to the Heroes of 9/11 - Live From Carnegie Hall

reviewText: This DVD is the second of two of Bill Gaither and his homecoming friend performing at Carnagee Hall, primarly in honor of 9/11.,The first DVD "God Bless America" I have owned for sometime now, this is the the second DVD continuing future into the night that they performed at Carnagee Hall. it was about a 4 hour performace, and was well received by those in a attendance.  "Let Freedom Ring" the second DVD is nearly good as the first "God Bless America"Buy or rent both if you want to listen to and watch a great group perform!
